intro: Caloncoba echinata, commonly known as the spiny caloncoba, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in ornamental horticulture and traditional medicine.
